org.magnos.asset
Interface AssetInfo

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseAssetInfo, ByteBufferInfo, CharacterInfo, CharArrayInfo, CharBufferInfo, ClassInfo, CsvInfo, FontInfo, JsonInfo, StringInfo, XmlInfo
public interface AssetInfo

The information associated with an asset. Enough information exists in the information to load the asset at a later time.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Method Detail

isType

boolean isType(Class<?> type)
Returns true if the given type is compatible with the assets type.

Parameters:
type - The asset type.
Returns:
True if the types are compatible.

isMatch

boolean isMatch(AssetInfo info)
Returns true if this AssetInfo has the same properties as the given info.

Parameters:
info - The info to compare to.
Returns:
True if the given info and this info are equivalent, otherwise false.

getType

Class<?> getType()
Returns the asset type.

Returns:
The asset type.

get

<A> A get()
Returns the asset. If the asset has not been loaded by the load() or set(Object) methods then this will return null. Otherwise if either method performed successfully the expected asset will be returned.

Returns:
The reference to the loaded asset or null if not loaded.

load

<A> A load()
       throws AssetException
Returns the asset, loading it if it hasn't been loaded yet. If there has been an error loading the asset an exception will be thrown.

Returns:
The reference to the loaded asset.
Throws:
AssetException - An error occurred loading the asset with the given request from the given source and in the given format.

create

<A> A create()
         throws AssetException
Creates the asset with the given request, source, and format but does not set the asset in this AssetInfo.

Returns:
The reference to the loaded asset.
Throws:
AssetException - An error occurred loading the asset with the given request from the given source and in the given format.

set

<A> void set(A asset)
Sets the asset.

Parameters:
asset - The new asset.

clear

void clear()
Clears the asset from this AssetInfo. Any load() invocations made after this will force a reload of the asset.

property

<T> T property(String name)
Returns the property with the given name.

Type Parameters:
T - The property type.
Parameters:
name - The name of the property.
Returns:
The property value.

property

<T> T property(String name,
               Class<T> type)
Returns the property with the given name.

Type Parameters:
T - The property type.
Parameters:
name - The name of the property.
type - The property type.
Returns:
The property value.

getProperties

String[] getProperties()
Returns the name of all properties available for this AssetInfo.

Returns:
The reference to the properties available for this AssetInfo. This should not be modified externally, any modifications will be made globally and will affect other callers of this method.

setInfo

void setInfo(AssetSource source,
             AssetFormat format,
             String request)
Sets the request, source, and format of the asset.

Parameters:
source - The source of the asset.
format - The format of the asset.
request - The request string to the asset.

getFormat

AssetFormat getFormat()
Returns the format of the asset.

Returns:
The reference to the format of the asset.

setFormat

void setFormat(AssetFormat format)
Sets the format of the asset.

Parameters:
format - The new format of the asset.

getSource

AssetSource getSource()
Returns the source of the asset.

Returns:
The reference to the source of the asset.

setSource

void setSource(AssetSource source)
Sets the source of the asset.

Parameters:
source - The new source of the asset.

getRequest

String getRequest()
Returns the request of the asset.

Returns:
The reference to the request of the asset.

setRequest

void setRequest(String request)
Sets the request of the asset.

Parameters:
request - The new request of the asset.

getPath

String getPath()
Returns the path of the asset. The path is typically a unique identifier to the asset.

Returns:
The reference to the path of the asset.

setPath

void setPath(String path)
Sets the path of the asset. This is typically done by invoking AssetSource.getAbsolute(String) passing the asset request in the method to get the path of the request.

Parameters:
path - The absolute path of the asset.
